starfleet_message: Captain’s Log, Stardate 47811.3 — The Enterprise has detected a derelict Klingon vessel drifting near the Typhon Expanse. Power is failing and life support minimal. The ship dates from the 22nd century, long before the Federation-Klingon Alliance. The crew appears to be alive, sustained by emergency systems, but barely. Their leader has transmitted an ancient Klingon battle code — a request for an honorable death.
mission_description: Respond to the distress signal of a dying Klingon ship seeking an honorable end. The Enterprise must decide whether to intervene, to honor their request, or to preserve life against their wishes.

dialogue_tree.line: Captain, the Klingon transmission is genuine. The channel used is ancient — reserved for warriors who seek death in battle. They ask for recognition, not rescue.

options.label: Number One, hail the Klingon commander directly.
options.crew_reply: Riker: Channel open. The Klingon ship’s captain identifies himself as K’Tor, son of Mavek. He says his crew will not die in the void like prey.

options.label: Data, confirm their ship’s condition.
options.crew_reply: Data: Warp containment failure is imminent. Core breach projected in eleven minutes.

options.label: Worf, what is their expectation of us?
options.crew_reply: Worf: They request that we fire upon them, Captain — so that they may die in combat and enter Sto'Vo'Kor with honor.

dialogue_tree.line: If we grant their request, we destroy a defenseless vessel. If we refuse, they die anyway — but dishonored in their own eyes.

options.label: Picard: Request to speak with their captain personally.
options.crew_reply: K’Tor: You are Picard of the Federation. You do not understand Klingon hearts. We have fought our last battle. Give us the death that was denied.

options.label: Worf, what would you suggest in this situation?
options.crew_reply: Worf: They wish to face their deaths as warriors. To deny them would be cruelty, Captain.

options.label: Data, review Starfleet records. Is there a precedent for firing on an otherwise defenseless ship?
options.crew_reply: Data: I've completed my review. There is no protocol for assisted destruction of an allied vessel, Captain.

dialogue_tree.line: If we are to act, it must be in accordance with both Starfleet ethics and Klingon tradition.

options.label: Authorize tactical readiness but hold fire until fired upon.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Acknowledged, Captain. I have informed them that only a gesture of battle will allow us to respond.

options.label: Refuse the request. Offer medical aid and rescue.
options.crew_reply: Crusher: Captain, they’re unlikely to accept our assistance. Sensors indicate power failure spreading throughout their life support.

options.label: Lt. Worf, prepare a photon torpedo spread. Ensure maximum containment.
options.crew_reply: La Forge: Targeting solution ready. Firing pattern configured for clean detonation.

dialogue_tree.line: Captain, the Klingon vessel’s disruptor is charging. They're firing. Minimal damage to the starboard nacelle.

options.label: Very well, Mr. Worf. Return fire — a single, disciplined shot.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Photon torpedo away. Direct impact to their forward hull. The Klingon vessel has been destroyed.

options.label: Mr. Worf, fire.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Firing Captain. The vessel’s containment field is collapsing. Warp core breach in progress... They’ve detonated, Captain. No survivors.

options.label: Mr. Worf, target their forward hull.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Hit confirmed on their forward hull Captain. Target destroyed.

dialogue_tree.line: The Klingon vessel is gone, sir. Residual ion traces are all that remain. No transmissions, no debris of significance.

options.label: Worf, stand down red alert.
options.crew_reply: Worf: Aye sir. Alert level one set.

options.label: Data, lower shields. Set course to our previous position.
options.crew_reply: Data: Yes sir. Course plotted and laid in.

options.label: Mr. Data, inform Starfleet command of our situation. Return to our original course.
options.crew_reply: Data: Understood, sir. Message sent. Course change confirmed.

reflection.line: They faced death without fear, Captain. Sto'Vo'Kor will welcome them.
Perhaps, Mr. Worf. But assisted suicide isn't something I'm comfortable with.

debriefs.text: The Klingon vessel was destroyed in accordance with their final request. Starfleet acknowledged the act as a cultural accommodation under extraordinary circumstances.
The crew of the derelict Klingon ship died with honor. Worf noted that the flames of Sto'Vo'Kor would burn brighter tonight.
Starfleet Command received Picard’s report and quietly commended his discretion. The Klingon High Council sent no reply, but none was needed.
The Enterprise hesitated too long. The Klingon ship's warp core breached before engagement, leaving the crew to die without combat. Worf requested a moment of silence.
The Klingon vessel misfired and exploded prematurely. Their final transmission was one of rage, not peace.
Starfleet Command criticized the decision to engage. The Klingon Council demanded explanation; Worf declined to speak.
